article.title: Cavity quantum electrodynamics in the non-perturbative regime

multiple_choice_question.text: **(a)** What does the variable ξi in Figure 1(a) represent?
choices: The charge of the i-th dipole.
The displacement of the charges in the i-th dipole.
The mass of the i-th dipole.
The position of the i-th dipole.

multiple_choice_question.text: **(b)** What type of dipoles can be modelled by the potential V(ξ) shown in Figure 1(b)?
**(c)** What are the two contributions to the total charge Q on the upper capacitor plate in Figure 1(c)?
choices: The charge from the voltage source and the induced charge from the dipoles.
The charge from the inductor and the induced charge from the capacitor.
The charge from the dipole displacement and the induced charge from the capacitor.
The charge from the voltage source and the induced charge from the inductor.

multiple_choice_question.text: **(a)** What is the behavior of the lower polariton branch for large wp and η > 0?
**(a)** What does the parameter α represent on the horizontal axis of the phase diagram?
choices: The strength of the dipole-field coupling.

multiple_choice_question.text: **(b)** What type of ground state is characterized by a finite polarization (Sx) ≠ 0?
**(c)** What happens to the superradiant and subradiant phases for α > 1?
choices: They merge and a new sharp transition between them appears.
They disappear and the system enters a new phase.
They remain separated but become indistinguishable.

multiple_choice_question.text: **(a)** What does the dimensionless parameter α in Formula (22) represent?
choices: The plasma frequency of the dipoles.
The filling factor of the dipoles.
